intro: Galium vernum subvar. hirticaule, commonly known as hairy bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous perennial native to parts of Europe and Asia. It features slender, ascending stems that are covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers in clusters during late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often hairy, contributing to its overall texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks.
